questions.qText: How many pairs of positive integers \(m, n\) satisfy \(\frac{1}{m} + \frac{4}{n} = \frac{1}{12}\) where \(n\) is an odd integer less than 60?
Determine the sum of all the real solutions of \(\left[\frac{x}{2}\right] + \left[\frac{2x}{3}\right] = x\).
Consider a one-one function \(A_n \to A_n\) where \(A_n = \{1,2,3,\dots,n\}\). Let \(T(n)\) be the number of functions from \(A_n \to A_n\) such that \(|f(i)-i|<2\).

Let \(f(x)\) be an even function defined using greatest integer and fractional part functions as given. Then the sum of all possible values of \(\lambda\) is
Let \(x,y,z\) be positive real numbers satisfying the given equations involving greatest integer and fractional part functions. Identify the correct statements.
Let \(f(x)=|x-2|\) and \(g(x)=f(f(\dots f(x)))\) applied \(n\) times. For \(k\in(0,2)\), identify correct statements.
Which of the following functions are periodic?
If a function satisfies \((x-y)f(x+y)-(x+y)f(x-y)=2(x^2y-y^3)\) and \(f(1)=2\), identify the correct statements.
If \(f:\mathbb{R}\setminus\{-1,k\}\to\mathbb{R}\setminus\{\alpha,\beta\}\) is bijective, identify the correct statements.
The graph of a function \(y=f(x)\) is shown. Identify the correct statements.

The number of nonempty subsets \(S\subseteq\{-10,-9,\dots,9,10\}\) satisfying \(|S|+\min(S)\cdot\max(S)=0\) is \(R\). Identify divisors of \(R\).
If \(f(x)\) is a polynomial of degree 4 with leading coefficient 1 satisfying \(f(1)=1,f(2)=2,f(3)=3\), find \(\frac14\left[\frac{f(-1)+f(5)}{f(0)+f(4)}\right]\).
If roots of \(|x-1|=2[x]-3\{x\}\) are \(x_i\), find \(\frac{\sum x_i}{5}\).
Consider a function \(f:A\to A\), \(A=\{1,2,\dots,7\}\) such that \(f(f(f(x)))=x\). How many functions can be formed?
Let \(f(x)=4x(1-x)\), \(0\le x\le1\). The number of solutions of \(f(f(f(x)))=x/3\) is
If \(f(x)=x^5+x^2+1\) has roots \(x_1,\dots,x_5\) and \(g(x)=x^2-2\), find \(g(x_1)\dots g(x_5)-30g(x_1x_2x_3x_4x_5)\).

Consider the function \(f(x)=\begin{cases}\sqrt{1-x^2}, & -1\le x<0 \\ x^2, & 0\le x<1 \\ \frac{(x-1)^2}{4}+2, & x\ge1 \end{cases}\). Consider another function \(g\) such that \(g(f(x))=x\ \forall x\ge -1\) and \(f(g(x))=x\ \forall x\ge0\).
The range of the function \(y=f(f(f(g(x))))\) is
The domain of \(y=g(g(g(f(x))))\) is
